name: Joshua Tree National Park
description: Two distinct desert ecosystems, the Mojave and the Colorado, come together in Joshua Tree National Park. A fascinating variety of plants and animals make their homes in a land sculpted by strong winds and occasional torrents of rain. Dark night skies, a rich cultural history, and surreal geologic features add to the wonder of this vast wilderness in southern California. Come explore for yourself!
shortDescription: Two distinct desert ecosystems, the Mojave and the Colorado, come together in Joshua Tree National Park. A fascinating variety of plants and animals make their homes in a land sculpted by strong winds...

operatingHours.description: Joshua Tree National Park is open 24 hours a day, 7 days a week, 365 days a year. Visitation increases as temperatures moderate in the fall, peaks during the spring wildflower season, and diminishes during the heat of summer. Some areas of the park are designated for day use only. Visitor centers keep separate hours; please see descriptions.

fees.title: Entrance - Private Vehicle
fees.description: 7-day vehicle permit, admitting the passengers of a single, non-commercial vehicle on the day of purchase and for the next six days.

fees.title: Entrance - Motorcycle
fees.description: Valid for 7 days. Admits up to 2 private, non-commercial motorcycles with up to 4 total passengers.

fees.title: Entrance - Per Person
fees.description: 7-day entrance fee, per person on foot or bike.

climate.weatherDescription: Days are typically clear with less than 25% humidity. Temperatures are most comfortable in the spring and fall, with an average highs around 85°F (29°C) and average lows around 50°F (10°C) respectively. Winter brings cooler days, around 60°F (15°C), and freezing nights. It occasionally snows at higher elevations. Summers are hot, over 100°F (38°C) during the day and not cooling much below 75°F (24°C) at night.

images.title: Quail Springs Area at Sunset
images.altText: The sky turns hues of pink and purple over a field of Joshua trees.
images.caption: Quail Springs area at sunset

images.title: Jumbo Rocks at Sunset
images.altText: people climbing on boulders are silhouetted against a colorful sunset sky
images.caption: Jumbo Rocks Campground is a fun place to explore the park's bouldered landscape.

images.title: Joshua Tree Junior Ranger
images.altText: a little girl smiles while wearing a Jr. Ranger hat and badge
images.caption: Kids of all ages can take part in Joshua Tree National Park's Junior Ranger program.

images.title: Hidden Valley Hiker
images.caption: Scrambling to the top of boulders in Joshua Tree can get you a great view.

images.title: Historic Keys Ranch
images.altText: an historic wood house seen through the missing windshield of an old, rusty vehicle
images.caption: The historic Keys Ranch can be visited only on a ranger-guided tour.

images.title: Lost Horse Valley
images.altText: Joshua trees grow on a flat plain with boulder outcrops and mountains in the distance
images.caption: Take in views of the park's iconic Joshua trees and rock outcrops in Lost Horse Valley.

images.title: Joshua Tree Sunset
images.altText: a fiery sky behind the silhouette of a Joshua tree
images.caption: The wide-open desert of Joshua Tree National Park makes for stunning sunsets.

images.title: Stars Over the Park Entrance
images.altText: night scene showing stars of the Milky Way over a sign saying "Entering Joshua Tree National Park"
images.caption: Enjoy some of the darkest night skies in Southern California.
